intro: Carmichaelia pilosa, commonly known as the silky kowhai, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting native birds and insects. Its leaves are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Carmichaelia pilosa thrives in coastal and lowland areas, often found in forest margins and clearings.
